summary: This is an internal email chain from October 30, 2020, discussing the status of e-discovery productions (SDNYPROD008 through SDNYPROD014) for the US v. Epstein case. The correspondence involves a contractor (PAE) and US Attorney's Office personnel, indicating that approximately 1.2 million records are being processed and imaged, with a rolling production expected but unlikely to be fully complete by a November 9, 2020 deadline.

persons.name: Nicholas Koontz
persons.context: He is the sender of the primary status update email, detailing the e-discovery productions being sent via FedEx and the imaging process for approximately 1.2 million records related to the US v. Epstein case.

events.title: Earliest availability of imaged records
events.description: The email states that images of approximately 1.2 million records will be available in the workspace at the earliest on this date.

events.title: Production deadline
events.description: A deadline for producing e-discovery materials; the correspondence indicates they will have at least some materials by this date but not all.

locations: USANYS (likely US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: Approximately 1.2 million records related to the US v. Epstein case were being imaged and processed for e-discovery as of late October 2020.
The e-discovery productions included SDNYPROD008 through SDNYPROD014, with SDNYPROD011 noted as a six-part production.
A contractor, PAE, was handling the e-discovery process, with Nicholas Koontz as the lead analyst.
There was internal concern about meeting a November 9, 2020 production deadline, with expectations of a rolling production but not full completion by that date.
